description: Ms. codex. Title provided by cataloger. 30 to 31 lines per page. Written in a medium small Maghribī script in black ink (faded to brown) with larger script for headings. European paper with watermark (see fol. 12); frame-ruled. Catchword on the verso of each leaf. Pagination using Western numerals on the center of the upper margin. Foliation in pencil using Western numerals. Worm eaten, with loss of text, especially on the last 5 leaves. R. Mach and E. Ormsby date this ms. from the 12th cent. H.
author: Ḍarīr, Muḥammad ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān, 1339-1404 or 5.
extent: vii, 46, vii leaves : paper ; 273 x 188 (210 x 140 to 203 x 148) mm. bound to 278 x 202 mm.
title: Kitāb Ismāʻ al-ṣumm fī ithbāt al-sharaf min qibal al-umm ... [etc.].
creator: ضرير، محمد بن عبد الرحمن
subject: Manuscripts, Arabic—New Jersey—Princeton
binding_note: Re-used modern bookbinding with the reproduction of an Islamic pattern on the upper cover and of a picture of amphoras on the lower cover. Modern paper pastedowns and fly- leaves.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
